title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: As i am relatively new to this Forum i want to kindly ask you if you can tell me where to start looking for a fault on this Board..

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
As always for T2 machines, start with DFU mode.
More information available here:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
Be sure to follow all the steps in the linked DFU tutorial.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
Tried to boot in DFU mode and tried to Restore as well as Repair - only got an Error saying that the Device was either disconected or connected twice.

Edit: Now tried Recovery Mode - Error 4010 but the Error Text is the same.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
PPBUS_G3H is stable?
Check it in both cases, when fan spins and not.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: PPBUS_G3H is stable at 12.89V Fan did not spin since DFU and Recovery mode.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: You should check if doesn't drop at the time you get the error.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
It "drops" to 12.69V shortly before the Error appears.

But I don't think this has to be the Error right ?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
That could be the sign of T2 communication problem.
May be T2 internal issue, or something else blocks it.
Check if any AWAKE, or SLPS2R voltage drops at same moment too.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: All of the SLPS2R Voltages drop 1 sec. before it fails. I also observed that the Recovery Mode is only Possible if battery is connected. Is this normal?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
The voltage drop explains the DFU error.
Do you note dropping voltage with battery connected too?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Yes it only starts in DFU or Recovery with Battery connected. If Battery disconnected, the Board only shows this LED lit up but not in Recovery or DFU mode.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Without battery, only charger, what voltages can you find on the board?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
PPBUS_G3H = 12.58V
PPBUS_HS_CPU = 12.58V
PP5V_G3S  = 5.10V
PPVIN_G3H_P5VG3S  = 12.57V
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H = 12.57V
PP3V3_G3H_RTC  = 3.29V
PP3V3_G3H  = 3.3V
PP1V8_G3S  = 1.804V
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 0V
CPU_VR_EN = 0.189V
PP1V05_PCH_CPU = 0,00V

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
"Do you note dropping voltage with battery connected too?"
Or voltages drop only with charger alone?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: no voltage drops with both of them plugged in

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Did you try DFU with both charger and battery connected?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Yes i tried both - without Battery it is not possible to Detect recovery on the Healthy Device

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Shouldn't lose the connection, if AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are steady, when battery is connected.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
Could you please tell me the exact Voltages ? Like the Names of them to Check ? All of Them ?

 [ATTACH type="full"]60314[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60315[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60316[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
PP1V2_AWAKE drops to 0 1 sec. before Error.
PP1V8_AWAKE drops to 0 1 sec. before Error.
PP3V3_AWAKE drops to 0 1 sec. before Error.

Just a little Edit: It only lets itself start into Recovery Mode..

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
Machine starts in Recovery Mode and stays on for long time?
Read the DFU tuorial linked on the forum and try to follow all its steps exactly.
Other people complained about autostart in Recovery Mode, but they finally succeed to put it in DFU.

AWAKE voltages drop even with battery and charger, both connected?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Yes both connected, then they drop and Come back again after a half a second

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
Any fault history available?
Check for liquid sign; especially on the audio board.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
I finally got into DFU Mode now. No Fault History available and no Liquid Damage sign..

EDIT: I tried to Revive the Device via:  [B]Actions > Advanced > Revive Device[/B] but it shows Error 75 "Missing Data Volume"
If i try to "Recover" it in DFU Mode it brings up the old Error with: "the Device was either disconected or connected twice." Device added from invalid state Restoring.. I have no clue why this Error shows up..

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
[ATTACH type="full"]60317[/ATTACH]
This is what Shows up after DFU Restore

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
You may have a problem with internal SSD.
Can you access it in Target Disk mode?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message:
I tried. I set one Mac in Target Disk Mode and connected it via USB-C. Then i tried to boot up our defect one with "Option" or "T" Key (i tried both)
Not possible..

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: Can you start Internet Recovery?

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: No unforunately i have no Picture since DFU & Recovery Mode try.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: This looks more like T2 internal problem.

title: 820-01958 A2179 dead only Fan Spin from time to time
message: But how to Check or proof? Why did I See the Apple Logo with the Loading Thing on the display and after setting it in DFU to try to Revive it it does only show up in Recovery mode..
